definition: variant of 告誡|告诫[gao4 jie4]
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: Try breathing easily and gently tell yourself to relax.
sentences.chinese: 讓呼吸平靜下來，輕輕告戒自己放鬆心情。

sentences.english: In addition, they were advised and counselled, and they had photographs taken of them.
sentences.chinese: 除此而外，他們還受到告戒，對他們進行了拍照。
但是，陳馮富珍告戒人們不要自滿。

sentences.english: Once constantly warned oneself as well.
Thomas Jefferson warned of entangling alliances.
They warned me not to be late.
MALKIN : I've been telling you for months, you cannot do that.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都在告戒你，你不能那樣做。

sentences.english: Consequently the ancients earnestly and tirelessly announces drop we, must not risk foolish " gas " .
sentences.chinese: 因而古人諄諄告戒我們，千萬不要冒傻“氣”。

sentences.english: Lists of this nature almost always tell you to set and write goals.
sentences.chinese: 列舉條目的性質總在告戒我們建立和記下目標。

sentences.english: Admonish your friends privately, but praise them openly. ---- Syrus.
sentences.chinese: 要私下告戒朋友，但是要公開誇獎朋友。

sentences.english: The doctor advised Jane should practise more.
sentences.chinese: 醫生告戒簡應該多鍛鍊身體。

sentences.english: They warned him against swimming in river.
sentences.chinese: 他們告戒他不要在那條河裏游泳。

definition: to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
variant of 警戒[jing3 jie4]/to warn
to remember with reverence/to bear in mind/to keep in mind
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
to let emotions affect one's decisions
